Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are like a roadside motel, below expectations for even the budget brand of national chains. Parking is awkward, where you have to walk down a ramp, past the hotel garbage, with no sidewalk, to get into the hotel. Cleaning staff threw away my zip-lock bag needed for TSA and front desk didn't have a replacement to provide. An elevator got stuck, not the one I was on, but they kept us on our elevator so they could work on the stuck one. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms pleasant and clean”
Reviews.Author: Catz22
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe the four points is that it once was an old hotel that has been renovated. So the hotel has an old feel about it. There was even a section that looked like the old style motel rooms (rooms with an outside balcony) that has now been enclosed and air-conditioned. Rooms were pleasant and clean. The only downfall is no fridge but they do provide an ice bucket and free ice.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: beatric
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here a lot. We travel in and out of the US via LAX so the location is perfect for us. If you're in LA on holiday, there are much better locations to stay, but if you're here for business and connecting through LAX, it's hard to beat. You can check in and check out at any time during the day or night, so you're not stuck with that problem of arriving at LAX at dawn, only to be told by reception that your room will not be available until after lunch. The Starwood Preferred Guest system works well and we often get a room upgrade - try not to stay in the Tower but ask for one of the recently renovated rooms on the upper floors of the main building. The new rooms have a strange designer storage system, where you put your stuff in cartons, instead of drawers, but it's no big deal. Four Points has retired the old polyester bed covers and linens, so the beds are comfortable and clean. Check-in could be faster, because they're usually short-staffed, but we like the people and put up with the wait. The coffee shop is over-priced and the breakfast is not great if you prefer to eat healthy, so we drive a mile to Trader Joe's and buy our own ingredients, stopping at Starbuck's along the way. If you don't have a car you can walk to the Starbucks next door in the Marriott. There's an ACE car rental office in the hotel which simplifies returning your car, and Budget car rental is directly across the road. ACE counter staff are incredibly slow at checking out cars, and if there are two or three customers waiting you'll spend at least an hour in line. We've never had any problems with ACE cars and they're much cheaper than Budget, but there are some horror stories about them online that you might want to read before renting - buyer beware. Parking at Four Points is $15 per day, you can usually get an undercover spot which is unusual for the LAX area, and the parking is on the hotel property - unlike the nearby Sheraton which offers parking at a remote site out back of the hotel strip. If you're accustomed to the service levels of a four star or five star hotel in Asia, the Four Points at LAX will come as a major shock - you get your own luggage out of the car, you put it on a luggage cart yourself, and you push it to check-in by yourself - usually while the guys at the concierge desk watch you. But you can get a room more or less any time during the year at under $100, there's a fridge in the room and the internet's free - so if you're a business traveler without a lot of luggage, this hotel saves you money on tips and it's really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “College move-in weekend in LA”
Reviews.Author: Marlo G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel since it was one that had a special family rate by my child's college and it turned out to be a pleasant place to stay. We had our entire family including elders and children. The children enjoyed swimming at the heated pool, and the elders enjoyed the simple but relaxing atmosphere. The rooms we were given were upgraded and clean. The beds were comfortable with clean sheets. The bathroom was older, but kept clean. For the price we paid, the value was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of Starwood brand”
Reviews.Author: honestreviews1777
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a Saturday night layover in LAX. The room was listed as $20 less than the Westin and since we were only going to be in the hotel for 7 hrs chose to save money. The Good: Shuttle was prompt at the airport. The lobby area was remodeled and the lobby bar had good food and 100 different beer selections. The Bad: The room was very old and the bed was not comfortable. There was a basket of a previous guests junk in the closet. There was a used bar of soap in the shower. There was hair in the bed. The door to the room and the room walls are very thin and we were up most of the night with loud hallway noise and what sounded like someon dropping bricks in the room down the hall. A call to the front desk did help to quiet it down but overall the sleep quality was poor. I got the feeling that the lower rate attracted a lower quality guest. Spend the extra $20 at stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds friendly faces”
Reviews.Author: Al L
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel after a long flight to the USA and a resting stop before a long trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wamby
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed in the Four Points at LAX. I previously stayed at a Four Points in Baltimore and thought it was nice. Unfortunately, this Four Points is run down and outdated. The beds were old, and the sheets had old stains on them. I decided not to take a bath because the bad didn't look clean. The toilet seat was also dirty and I had it wipe it down. Since my mother was tired from the flight, I decided to tough it out instead of going through the pain of changing rooms or even changing hotels. I won't be returning to this hotel, especially at the price they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun14_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about $100 a night but you've never know it from its appearance - very clean, aesthetically pleasing and friendly, courteous, well-dressed and maintained staff. Jorge Medrano was a great service provider, with a smile, engaging personality and exhibited patience. My only "complaints" are that the LAX bus is right outside of my window so I heard it throughout the night making stops and announcments (any way to create noise-proof windows?) and a pair of my socks went missing and despite my efforts to retrieve them, they were not found. Still, overall, a great stay. Will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite "park n fly" hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: rscearcy
Reviews.Content: After trying other parking options when flying out of LA (we live a few hours away, so it's not just a drive across town), we stumbled upon the Four Points LAX. Now, we plan our trips around at least one night's stay with parking while we're gone. The rooms are great, well furnished and clean, with beds that really let us sleep well. There are two meal options downstairs, both of which have good food at a reasonable price. The staff is friendly and accommodating from the front desk to bell services to food and housekeeping. The hotel is close to LAX, with free shuttles that run between the hotel and the airport. Dropping off and picking up your car is easy. The hotel has become such an integral part of our travel plans that we're almost disappointed when we find a trip that doesn't permit a hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st choice for business”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient not only to the airport, but to the business community as well. The staff is friendly, helpful, and efficient. The rooms are well maintained and the beds are very comfortable. The restaurant and bar have a good variety that is well priced. If you are a beer lover, tey have more varieties than you can count. The room rates are very reasonable, especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience in Four Points by Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: ws w
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience in Four Points in LAX. I traveled for the labor day holiday to LA and booked a 2 queue size bed nonsmoking room. And when I arrived at the hotel, the assigned me a room in 9 floor first, but I found that room has already taken by others when I open the door, it is really embarrassment. I went down stairs and complain with the guy in front desk, they reasigned my another room. And that room has only one king size bed, this room is completely different from what I booked! Anyway, the worst management and worst service I have even encountered in my life. I would suggest you not to book this hotel anymore!

Reviews.Title: “One exceptional customer service experience”
Reviews.Author: Laxmanboiler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and children one night in order to catch an early flight the next morning. The hotel was about what I expected in terms of room quality and service but what I did not expect was an instance of great customer service. A hotel employee named Musie came to pick up my bags early in the morning. We had a problem with my 3 year old and he waited patiently for 10 minutes often offering to help. He then not only waited for us to check out but carried our bags clear across the entire back lot and loaded them into my car. I love great customer service and always feel the need to point out instances where I feel I am getting 5 star treatment. Thank you to this hotel employee.

Reviews.Title: “Second time in this hotel and we will come back”
Reviews.Author: Crustiviajero
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2010 and we decided to come back for one night as we had to take an airplane in the early morning. The check-in was fast and after that I could return the car to Avis that are located in the same street. The rooms are fine with very comfortable rooms. The bathrooms are a little bit old but at least they are clean. We had dinner in the bar and the food was tasty with very friendly staff (also speaking spanish) If we come back to LA and have to stay in the airport, we will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: beachshore
Reviews.Content: The Four Points Sharaton hotels are the best hotels I have ever been to. When I first visited the hotel it was because of the great location. Then it became routine and the hotel became familiar and unusually comfortable.From the service to the pool everything in the hotel was excellent. The hotel was so satisfying whenever I travel I look for a local Four points Sharaton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 24hr check-in; stay away from the central tower”
Reviews.Author: MrYu
Reviews.Content: Cliff's notes: super deals for flights out of LAX, especially if you are catching a red eye to east coast, see if they still have the 24-hour Check-in promo (they do as of this writing). Stay away from the horrible central tower, room numbers from about 32 to 59 or so. Other towers are just fine. The perfect: The 24 hour check-in promo, still available on the hotel's web site as of this writing (Aug, 2011). If you have a red eye flight, you can check in for 24 hours, so you can check out not at noon on the day of the flight, but at 9pm for instance. It requires you to check in at 9pm or later the day of your check-in. This was absolutely unbelievable: I didn't need to check out in the morning, could work in the office all day on Friday, get back to the hotel around 8pm, take a shower and change, relax a little and make it without rush to the 11pm flight back to DC. You have to email the hotel after making the reservation and ask for the 24-hour check-in. I think it's designed for the one night stands, but I stayed there twice, for 5 and 4 nights and was able to get this promo with no issues. If I were managing this hotel (or others for that matter), I'd switch all my rates to 24 hours -- the cost of having a few extra maids to turn rooms around in the evening would probably be much less than the added revenue from happy guests. The noon checkout at hotels is an atavism from the old times in my opinion, especially so for the west coast. The good: All the staff, except for one scared front desk clerk, are very helpful, courteous and can handle the high load of guests supremely well. The management is especially willing to sort out issues even when the issue is not the hotel's fault. I am impressed and that's not easy to do. Convenient location for everything, including LAX; you get a free shuttle there, too, that runs every 10-15 mins or so. If you are arriving in the evening and need a car from Budget (horrible service, but cheap) in the morning, make the car reservation for the morning: you can walk across the street and pick up the car. OK food in the restaurant for dinner, don't know about breakfast. Rooms outside of the central tower (those that aren't numbered 32-59 or so) are very much standard for Four Points with all the standard stuff, including a bottle or two of water that's free. The rooms are a bit more spacious than your typical Four Points, even, somewhere in the range of Marriott's Courtyard. Cool views both on the west and on the east, especially if, like me, you like to watch planes. Decent coffee and pastry stand in the morning, spacious and pleasantly looking lobby. Outside swimming pool. Car rental agency inside the hotel. I can't comment on it, I didn't use them, but I saw a few people do, so I imagine they are not terrible. The bad: Not much, except for slow service at the bar and the central tower, but the latter is way beyond bad, it's ugly. Naturally, the hotel's computers aren't designed to handle the 24hr check-in, so one of the two times I didn't leave my stuff in the room in the morning of the Friday and got kicked out despite the 'do not disturb' sign. When i got back at 8pm, the room had already been given to someone else, but the management admitted the mistake, apologized, gave me another room for an hour, offered a dinner and generally handled the situation in an extremely professional manner. So, if you are doing the 24hr check-in, in the morning of the check-out day stop by the front desk and ask them to make sure your key card will work and the parking pass if you have it will work. What they do is simply change the dates on both for the following day and the computer shows the room as occupied and your keys work. You do not get charged for an extra night. The ugly: The central tower. The main problem there is that it's designed like an old motel: you have the windows of your room facing not outside of the building, but outside in the hall where people walk. So, you have a choice: either draw your vinyl window shade completely and have no natural light in the room, or have your privacy. Can't have both, 'cause the window is big and if your curtain is not drawn completely, you are like in a zoo on display for everyone, who walks by to view. I, for one, can't wake up without the natural light and I value my privacy, so the one week I stayed there it was a torture. The central tower rooms are tiny, not enough space to even put the ironing board except it one corner of the room, but then you can't walk around it. The power outlets in the room are so old and loose, the plugs are falling out of them. Not sure what the fire marshal has to say about it, but I can say it's annoying when you figure out your cell phone is not charged in the morning. You can hear other people through the walls of the central tower, which is not terrible, but certainly is annoying, especially combined with other issues there.

Reviews.Title: “I always felt welcome and at home.”
Reviews.Author: Bloopy
Reviews.Content: The staff made an effort to make me felt known and welcome. Everyone was super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive”
Reviews.Author: gfarhady
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby of the hotel is fantastic; it is a beautiful lobby with staff available to help with luggage. The people at the front desk are very helpful and friendly, providing awesome service. We got a room in the west tower and headed up to the 9th floor with our luggage only to walk into a hall that smells like must, bad eggs and old chinese food. The carpets are stained and peeling off the floor in some areas. The smell of must and stained carpets continue into the rooms though the sheets and bathrooms are clean. This is not the kind of quality we have come to expect from the Sheraton hotel and while the prices may be cheap, one could easily stay at a dingy motel and get the same kind of room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location next to airport with nice pool area”
Reviews.Author: MovinOnAlong
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and was upgraded to a nicer room which offset the bite of a $19 self parking fee. Friendly staff, quick check in and out. Spacious, clean room with flatscreen TV, soft linens and towels with workspace and small refrigerator. The pool area is sunny and draws a crowd. While acceptable for me, the parking does require a hike around the back of the hotel and up a long ramp. While security and lighting is in place, those uncomfortable with such an excursion after dark might want to consider the valet parking for $27. Did not have meals at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD”
Reviews.Author: coolSH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week with our family .Their carpet in the hotel lobby and even room needs to be replaced ,room looks so dull and unclean. They have kept their front desk very clean and neat but that is just show off...I checked in to my room at 2 Am in the morning...and then i saw my AC is broken I called front desk and she said that she will said Engineer...at 2 am in the morning...come on ;)...I am a human being and I sleep in the night...I had to argue her...to get a separate room key....In all I would say that is the worst hotel I had ever booked,,,,,and I am not going back....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and we'll always stay here when in LA”
Reviews.Author: shalini m
Reviews.Content: Wish I could give it 6 stars! The hotel is so good that it took us by surprise! Itâ€™s 5 star comforts in a 3 star price and the location could not be better! The General Manager, Phil was very generous to send us a â€˜welcome cardâ€™ along with complementary beer and snack. There was a little confusion where we thought that the breakfast was included in the rate and even though it wasnâ€™t, he was very sweet to provide us with complementary coupons. You get treated like royalty by each and every staff member and they really go out of their way to make sure that youâ€™re comfortable. Maria at the Bar was very kind to cater to our needs with a terrific smile. I just cannot say enough words about this place here. The Brewsterâ€™s and Pool Bar are amazingly good. The rooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable, and the pillows are special! Overall it was a great experience and Four Points LAX is definitely the only place that weâ€™re going to stay at whenever we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Highlite of trip.”
Reviews.Author: Riderrag
Reviews.Content: Just the first stop on a two week vacation, motorcycling thru the northwest. Started in LA and traveled thru Cali, Nev, Utah, Idaho, Mont, and into BC, Canada. Wonderful way to start a 2600 mile bike trip. Everyone was cordial and very helpful. Celine and the gang in the bar would make any trip worthwhile. Attitude and courtesy were exceptional. Recommend stopping in for any reason you can think of!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Clare L
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are not top quality - closer to motel standard than high class hotel. And certainly the bathrooms could be a bit bigger. BUT for the price I found this hotel was quiet - better than other hotels in the area! - the rooms reasonable for an overnight, and the food in the restaurant was great. The best part was the extra effort they went to to get me early access to a room. I requested early check-in as I was arriving at about 9am and they had sorted it out without any hassle. Free access to 15 mins of internet time topped it off. Free scheduled shuttle from the airport was a major plus - better than being stuck having to call and wait for a pick-up. Overall - I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Price By the Airport”
Reviews.Author: cloudiedays
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to pay too much for hotel and since we went during Memorial Weekend, everything was just about pricey or sold out of rooms. There's not much jazz to this place. There's no extraordinary view. Our room faced the front, so we can see the rental cars pulling our and being returned. The outdoor pool are is nice to sit out, but we didn't have time to relax around. The room was comfortable and spacious. The bathroom felt very sterile and not updated, but it was stocked with the amenities you need and clean. The bathroom was spacious though. Complimentary Nestle water was great. They have a huge empty fridge for you to stock your own items. The staff were all helpful and casual/laid back. The place is always bustling with people. They have a lot in the back, while also having a small parking area (Valet) in the front. My friend lived in LA and a good 15 minute drive from the airport/hotel, so we didn't rent a car. The drive to places isn't as bad. It took around 30mins to get to Santa Monica, which isn't bad considering LA traffic. Wouldn't mind staying here again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Its not worth it. Another terrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: Make_It_Right_2011
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st night here. I would like to share my horrible experience with all travellers around the world who are going to Los Angeles either for vacation/business or with a family, especially Europeans who might not be aware of the situation. Do not stay here. Its not worth it. Location is not to far from a bad side of town. Paid the entire stay in advance, 2 nights, $190 in full - several days ago with a credit card. At the check-in, a woman by the name of "G" ( name witheld by the author ) the unfriendly supervisor, demended additional $100 in cash or $50 with credit card a day, additional "deposit" just in case that : " when we leave we do not take their flat TV ( the one they so desperatelly advertise ) with us back home. Even though these 2 nights were booked and paid in advance entirelly - IN FULL - she stated that if I do not give additional $100 in cash "for the unforseen situations in the future", we can go to another hotel. As you can see, the staff here wasn't friendly, efficient and helpful. She clearly demonstrated she did not care if I would stay there or not - and if 2 nights were already paid. She said that if I dont give her additional $100 in cash she would not check me in but would not hesitate to call the police and ask me to leave the property if necessary even though 2 nights were already paid in FULL. I have degree in Criminology and this was totally out of line for a hotel supervisor to say to a guest who already invested money in this travel, flight and hotel. I did not get used to such terrible and direspectful hotel check-in service, I was shocked for awhile in disbelief. She then offered me to refund my booking agency in full for both nights, would not check me in - without $100 in cash under any circumstance, however the refund money for 2 nights which had been already paid in full - would be posted back to my Credit Card and become available in a week from now. In other words, this hotel got paid for 2 nights in advance, in FULL and secured the payment in FULL - made a promise that I would have this room for 2 nights, but would not care if they cancel my stay at the Check-in point unless I give them additional $100 in cash, which would leave me to have NO hotel for 2 nights. While they still have my $190 which would be unavailable to me for another 7 days. I so badly wanted to make reservation with another hotel. When the business doesnt care about having the payment in full already in their hands and in advance, and they treat me as if - my money and time does not matter to them, and their promise means nothing, the reservation means nothing, the relationship with booking agency means nothing, the payment in full in advance means nothing, I as a guest mean nothing - then I do not want to reward the bad business for the bad business and a bad treatment. However, my option to make reservation the very same hour, and the very same day with another hotel were limited at that point, and would require another $200 dollars, because the reservation would have to be made the very same day - and I would have to travel to that place, and pay all inconvencies myself, in addition to spending another $200 and lose additional valuable time! Had I known this will take the place, I could have picked another hotel and had great experience. I travel relativelly often, prior to this hotel, had stayed in 2 other hotels in Los Angeles. Neither insisted on additional cash for already paid nights in advance, had undisclosed hidden charges, put a condition on a check-in or offered such a poor treatment to the guests! I want to save someone else the headache of staying in this hotel: don't ever consider staying at the Four Points LAX. I won't recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to finish a holiday trip to California with a good night sleep and a smile. Never again. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: DirkTid
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit tired but likely similar to other LAX area hotels and good for the price plus the staff are extremely friendly, helpful and service minded. Good pool and good location if you want LAX. Also excellent selection of local beers on tap at good prices. Make sure to checkout the wednsday special at the pool if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre flight stop”
Reviews.Author: Andrew J
Reviews.Content: Stayed before heading back home to NZ. Great links to airport and near the hire car places. Good pool, clean with nice friendly staff. Would use it as a starting or finishing point of a US trip anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a trip out of the country and used Starwood Points. Needed to leave my car. The staff there was very helpful in arranging for me to leave my car at the hotel while I was gone. The room was great-clean, well appointed, and cozy. All the usual amenities that I have come to expect as a Starwood Preferred Guest.

Reviews.Title: “24 hour room brilliant for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Lynds1109
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of an offer (that was a little hard to track down) but it allowed us to check in for 24 hours irrespective of their usual restrictions. As we were only in LA for 24 hours as a stop over to catch our breath with a toddler before heading to London this was brilliant and we got plenty of sleep. The room was perfectly comfortable and we appreciated the late bar service for the toddlers food but the rest was incredibly basic and average. Bathroom in particular was quite run down. Breakfast was terrible but again it was included in the price and worked for us. Was surprised that there was no help with baggage on arrival / departure which would have been useful. Also, we had pre booked a crib for the infant and was advised it would be in the room at check in - it wasn't. We rung housekeeping and an hour later it still hadn't arrived. We went out for 3 hours and it still wasn't there on arrival so had to ask again. When it did arrive, it was a lovely crib for an overnight. All in all, far from my favourite hotel but outweighed by the 24 hour room and the lovely, prescious sleep we enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Great service comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rosiebakes
Reviews.Content: Friendly, staff service was great special mention for Celine, Valerie & Patty exceptional people always happy to see you

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and service oriented staff”
Reviews.Author: Obtravel11
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed more than anything with the staff of this hotel. I met Phil Baxter, the GM, at their beer tasting event. He was so friendly and service oriented. Edith at the front desk was so helPful and got my room totally square away. Marcela morales and Maria Gonzales were all smiles and very helpful at the restaurant both times I went to have breakfast. And once in said restaurant Patty was so accommodating and made me feel at home even though she was busy between numerous tables. This attention from top to bottom made my stay so much better.The only drawback I thought was the kind of slow service in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: vrdunn
Reviews.Content: Great place for the price. My daughter loved the pillows(: It would be very benifical to guest if you cleaned the windows for better vision(: and cheaper parking...but overall it was amazing(: My family and I will surely stay again(: Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Service- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shannon T
Reviews.Content: First, the shuttle to and from the airport is such a great convenience! Both drivers (to and from) were so friendly and helpful lifting my enormous amounts of luggage that I seem to always have with me. The check-in process was just as pleasant. The woman was very sweet and accomodating. I had been flying all day and she could tell. My room was not ready yet as it was before 3pm west coast time. She found me another room, and quickly, which I was very grateful for. The hotel itself and the rooms were very clean and updated. The housekeeping staff was extremely friendly as well and went out of their way to find me a shower cap and provide me with additional face clothes and towels. I ordered room service twice and ate in their restaurant for breakfast twice. All of the food service staff that I encountered, and spoke with on the phone, were wonderful. My waiter at breakfast even wrapped up my fruit to go so that I could take it on the flight home with me as a snack. He was kind enough to box it and completely wrap it in plastic wrap so that it wouldn't leak. There is one staff member, though, who stood out from the rest. Martin Gil, at the front desk, not only helped me by quickly printing a presentation that I realized printed incorrectly, but also was so personable and even gave me a wonderful pep talk before what would be my first presentation in my new job to my company's and one of our customers entire executive staff. Four Points should feel lucky to have so many wonderful people on their staff. I highly recommend this hotel. It is convenient, clean, and has an amazing staff. The free wifi is also a huge plus in my book as well. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: stephenongch
Reviews.Content: Convenient shuttle to airport and FlyAway to city. Near Burger King but not to any supermarket or Seven-Eleven. Housekeeping missed our room one out of four nights. Very old bed, blanket and soft pillows. No comforter/duvet and firm pillows even from housekeeping. Cant understand how they qualified under Starwood Brand with such old bed.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia C
Reviews.Content: We have been stopping at the Sheraton Four Points, LAX on our way to Hollywood to visit my son, for many years. The staff has always been very helpful and friendly. On occasion we have arrived very late at night and were always pleased to see that Brewsters Bar and Grill was not only open but served delicious food and drinks at very reasonable prices. In addition, they remodeled this restaurant and it now has little nooks and crannies for you to sit and relax in. If you have AAA you can get a great rate that includes a great buffet breakfast at their Comfort Restaurant. Refrigerators are in the rooms, with a free bottle of water and most important, very comfortable beds. Add all that to a newly renovated pool and free use of thier computers and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: W R S
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the room was very clean and outstanding. Parking is a little confusing on arrival, but once you find the parking entrance, it's easy. They are working on improving it though so it will be easier to see. It's a great place to overnight if you have a flight the next day. Easy getting on their shuttle to LAX. We spend a few days in Santa Barbara and have to fly into and out of LAX and use a rental car. It's so much easier to check into this hotel, then return the car a night earlier and avoid to early morning traffic. All rental car agencies are within walking distance to the hotel. A 10 to 15 minute walk at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: dpclemente
Reviews.Content: Since moving to Saint Johns Florida 6 years ago (Mar 2005) whenever we fly to California specifically Los Angeles to visit Family and Friends in Orange, Riverside and Los Angeles Counties, we have stayed at least one night at the Four Points LAX. The staff has always been very good. We have enjoyed the service and cleanliness of the Hotel. I would recommend it highly. Being a member of Starwood Preferred Guests is also a plus. Thanks DP Saint Johns, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and I'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: ELGee2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property late July for business and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff at the front desk was very professional and knowledgeable. This property is a no nonsense hotel with all the amenities that one needs to conduct business. The breakfast was fast and offered options of both a buffer or off the menu items. The lobby is abuzz with guests using the computers and/or meeting and greeting that keeps the place hopping. The lobby area overlooks the outdoor pool that was well attended while I was there. This location has a handy shuttle service to and from LAX. I never had to wait more that 10 minutes or so in either direction. This property has two towers. In the tower closest to the main entrance the rooms are more fresh as they were updated with new decor. The other tower is going through renovations and frankly could use it. I have stayed at many LAX properties including the Hilton, Westin, Sheraton and Marriott and I now stay here as the WiFi is free, the staff is always bright and cheery and the room rates are much more reasonable. I will be back to this location for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Room and Food was Great”
Reviews.Author: gforce365
Reviews.Content: we usually do not order room service because of how expensive and banal the good usually is, but since we were getting a 50% discount, we decided to try it out. It was some of the best food we have had in a long time. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: highspiriti
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay and was pleasantly surprised. Some of the previous reviews proved not to be the situation when I recently stayed at this hotel. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perked up and Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kathy6347
Reviews.Content: I have often stayed at 4 pts because of the convenience to the airport, shuttle service etc. but this time I was really Wowed by the updated decor and friendliness of the staff as well as their extra efforts to perform good service. Will always be my first choice when I return too LAX!

Reviews.Title: “My wife and grandkids loved their overnight stay before flying home.”
Reviews.Author: John4260
Reviews.Content: The overnight stay was perfect for everyone prior to flying home. The grandkids loved the pool and the hotel staff was great to everyone in our group.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sjagger
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome stay at the Four Points by LAX. Not only did the GM engage me on Twitter, but he sent up a nice welcome gift to my room. First class! The hotel is clean, the staff is helpful and the location is perfect. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: juan_ignacio_blanco
Reviews.Content: Close to LAX, good menu, great room, excellent beer selection, great service and nice beds!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Easy Place to Stay Before or After Long Journeys Thru LAX”
Reviews.Author: BradS6
Reviews.Content: What a great staff. I stay at this property at least 10x per year. I am arriving or departing from LAX on early morning flights, and I have learned that it is much more comfortable to stay the night before a 7 or 8 am departure, than to brave the 405 at that hour. The hotel staff (especially the very attentive Front Desk Manager, Justin Jaramillo) have come to know me - always, always with a recognizing smile. Justin has my room ready at any hour of arrival....what a godsend he has become. Being an SPG Platinum member definitely has it's advantages, but I always see that Justin and his team welcome all guests in the same manner as they do me. The hotel is clean, efficient and warm. The rooms are always ready, and the beds very comfortable. Even after all these years of traveling on early morning flights, I am still anxious about making my departure on time, and don't sleep well the night before. They have been so kind to call me at the specified time, and I don't think that I have pushed the boundaries of rushing to the gate in quite a long time. I never wait for their airport shuttle, more than 15 minutes on the outbound and at the terminals, returning to the property. It is comforting to know that I can always count on the Four Points Sheraton LAX to take care of me when I am a bit stressed out getting to, and returning from the terminals. A big thank you, to Justin and all the rest of the Four Points Sheraton LAX staff, for facilitating a restful environment, a clean and comfortable stop, and providing efficient caring hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reliable accomodations provided!”
Reviews.Author: alvnmri
Reviews.Content: This place is a great option for anyone travelling to and from LAX. Front desk staff is helpful and delightful. Juan is one of the clerks that get my vote! Keep up the great job guys!

Reviews.Title: “A return stay”
Reviews.Author: ShortyTheDreamer
Reviews.Content: When it is necessary to overnight at LAX we can always rely having a comfortable stay at this hotel. It's also a well located hotel for visitors to LA's west side, only minutes away from the beaches and shopping without the beach-side prices. We are returning guest and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, old decoration, terrible air condicioning... avoid it”
Reviews.Author: ViLaruccia
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week and I would say that the hotel is disapointing... carpet stains, very noisy and old air condicion (it is a big device near the window, makes a lot of noise and keep turning on and off....) I had to turn it off to sleep because of the noise... Hotel decoration is old, few TV channel options, the parking is very expensive and the internet connection gets very slown sometimes..... I have chose the hotel by the location and price, but it does not worth what they charge... based on what i experienced here should be easy to find something better nearby Avoid at all cost rooms near avoid the vending machines and ice makers, because they are very noisy, i have noticed the noise on the corridor while waiting for the elevators, very loud

Reviews.Title: “Back of a building”
Reviews.Author: MamaT74
Reviews.Content: The sheets were not soft at all. We iched all the time we were there. Sorry but I will not stay at your hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..........”
Reviews.Author: macktj
Reviews.Content: I Chose the hotel due to the location to Lax Airport. They had a shuttle bus to provide us to the hotel that was a plus. Got there the hotel entrance was beautiful the front desk service was fast no long wait. The room was nice and large plenty of space my room was the king size standard the bed was fresh the pillows was fluffed I like there was no old hotel smell which is great in my book. The Bathroom was nice and clean no odd stains Lol TV with basic channels. For dinner we went the the hotel cafe the food was good no complaints except for the couple making out in corner it's LA. The hotel was a good experience I'm still new to TripAdvisor so I must start taking pictures so please forgive me. But overall I will stay there again........

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money...”
Reviews.Author: JoshandIssa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points LAX when waiting for a connection to an International flight out of LAX. The shuttle service was shared between the Four Points and another property nearby. Even at 11 PM and 11 AM (times we used the shuttle), the buses were PACKED and only came every 20-30 minutes. Be ready to wait for an extra shuttle if you're towards the end terminals at LAX! Now onto the hotel itself- The lobby was nice enough, there's a restaurant, bar and a gift shop. The restaurant that we had planned to eat at had closed earlier and the gift shop was also closed. This left us pretty much one option as far as food- room service. There aren't any other food options within walking distance except a Burger King down the road, so keep that in mind. The room itself left much to be desired. The hotel rooms look very, very worn. You can tell that the non-smoking rooms were converted because the walls still smell of decades of smoke. The bed was the most rock solid thing I think I've ever slept on, and the outside noises were pouring in through the poorly insulated window. The air conditioning hardly worked, it kept the room around 80 degrees overnight- which was actually warmer than it was outside. The bathroom was pretty small and the tub looked 30+ years old, it had to be the oldest tub I've ever seen at a hotel! They had the typical "fake ceiling" that is used to cover up an older, mold damaged ceiling. The sink was built onto a wooden vanity constructed on a base of some unpainted 2X4's, maybe they had just replaced the wood or something, but it looked tacky as heck. Overall the property is old and shows it's age. The "non smoking" aspect doesn't fly when the hallways and rooms just reek of lingering decades of smoke. We got a decent deal (under $90) but in the end, there were properties around the area that were a few bucks more and next time I'll be looking into one of those. I guess you can't expect a great hotel that has rates under $100 and is in the middle of a big city and adjacent to an airport, but they can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a layover”
Reviews.Author: Crewguy
Reviews.Content: Business required a layover at LAX, so I chose the Four Points Sheraton (Gold SPG member). The hotel has recently undergone a renovation and it's well worth checking out. The rooms are fresh and the beds are comfortable. The room is large and roomy with plenty of plug ins at the work station for all your portable devices. The bathroom layout is a different than the typical hotel, but it's quite refreshing. Did not have a chance to check out the pool, but there are cabanas available. No opportunity to check the restaurants wither.

Reviews.Title: “When professionalism meets personal touch you get Four Points by Sheraton at LAX”
Reviews.Author: DessieK
Reviews.Content: Our company had two seminars at this location in March 2011. From the very first contact until the last guest left all Sheraton employees were at their very best-and that's putting it mildly... The catering manager Eden is a blessing - our events were perfect till the last minute. She would anticipate our needs and proactively suggest various options until we found the perfect fit. We were treated with so much care, so much attention and everywhere we turned found only perfection. At the end of the day- when it was all over and we wanted to go sightseeing, they went out of their way to find us a rent-a-car after we were turned down by all airport rental places. This place works like a well organized bee hive - smooth, on time, as promised-just perfect. I would HIGHLY recommend it for any events and would definitely by all means return!!! Thank you Eden, Muhsie-thank you Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it wil be back”
Reviews.Author: Love2727
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the four points. The first room they gave me was an indoor room, king side bed, where u had to way out into the hall way and look out a window to see outdoors it was terrible. I didnt like the room at all because, I felt like I was closed in. So I called and ask for another room facing the pool (inside room on 6th floor) .when u look out the window you saw the swimming pool!! It was great and so much bigger then the other room. I didnt eat there , there where other places around the hotel to eat that was a lot cheaper. Parking was 10 dollars a day with my discount. The rooms were very nice and clean, quiet. .. I allowed them to clean the room daily and they did a great job. I love my stay at the 4points sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “room not ready at 9:00 pm”
Reviews.Author: kdf1963
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed that when we arrived after a very long drive, our room was not ready even though it was 9:00 pm. We left to return our rental car, adn when we got back the room was still not ready, now it was 10:00pm and we moved to a different room. The room also smelled like someone had been smoking in it prior to our arrival before being changed. Also dissapointed to find out upon check-in, that because we booked thru Hotels.com we would not be credited for the room night or recieve SPG points. This is one of the main reasons we chose this hotel for our stay at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Hooman67
Reviews.Content: Amiable staff, I had to make a trip to San Diego so being near to the airport suited me very well. The rent a car vis a vis the hotel was very helpful either. I was very pleased with the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel help were very courteous, helpful and very professional.”
Reviews.Author: ruth_tarango
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the way the hotel help made me feel so comfortable. They were very courteous from the valet to the waiters & waitresses. We were very fortunate to be served by a waitress named Estela Estrada, who totally went out of her way toserve us and was very helpful. I wanted to make sure I wrote this review to let the hotel know that their service is excellent by outstanding employees such as Estela Estrada. I would definately return back to this hotel and recommend it to all my friends and family, even strangers. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Erkadahl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value if you need something close to LAX before a flight. My only complaint was safety, as they put both myself and another peer near exits. As a single female, being in an outside room next to the exit is the least safe room location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for stopover”
Reviews.Author: xxJazzxx
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a stopover, close to the airport with a free shuttle.We stayed there for a two night stopover, its close to the LAX transit centre for buses and about a 20 min walk to the supermarket. Its very comfortable and i really liked staying there. Only problem I had is the clock was wrong which I didnt realise, i woke up at 8am and it said it was 2am, which caused a slight problem but i should have checked it was right when i got there. Other than that would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the super 8 lax”
Reviews.Author: krush1974
Reviews.Content: There was a 19 dollar parking fee assessed that was not noted on Priceline when I booked. The room had multiple holes in walls that were poorly filled in. There is a picture or mirror missing from a wall. The bedding was worn out. There were enough towels for 1 person. The towel rack was mounted to the wall on a slant. There is a water mark on the ceiling above the bed. Stay at the super 8 LAX...it's cleaner, cheaper, nicer with free parking and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The worst ! 30 minutes to check in ! No toilet paper and black hair over the bed bath shower bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Gotitrex
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel to date. We spend 140 nights a year and never again a this place. 30 minutes to check in not acceptable for this starwood gold. No toilet paper and what appeared to be black pubic hair all over the uncleaned room. It it were not for the fact we were only there for 7 hours we would of requested a room change or another hotel. Vile and not the usual four points standard that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Matched Nordstrom's for Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: queen_bee_network
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Preferred Guest, I received customer service above and beyond the call of duty from two phenomenal employees---Juan and Martin...they bring back the true meaning of exceptional "customer service." The room service food was well-priced, delivered promptly, and tasted delicious! I wanted a hotel that was totally nonsmoking and no pets. I had an appointment at UCLA and traveled the extra distance from UCLA to stay at this hotel, based on the recommendation of a very valued friend. Four Points did not disappoint....well worth the extra travel time.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel a few years ago, with vaguely positive recollection about it, I figured I'd book it again for a one night stay for business this month. Maybe my memory is faulty, or more likely, the hotel has gone down hill ... a lot! When I checked in, I was given a room in the back building, which requires a walk through the ballroom area to a very remote bank of elevators. No big deal, but that building seems to have been annexed onto the main building (because the upper floors don't line up. Perhaps the distance from the main building is a problem for the housekeeping staff, because when I got there (to a very hot room), the bathroom was short some towels and soap, and worse, there was a wet dirtly towel lying on the desk!! So, frustrated (and not wanting to collect my things and trek back to the front desk, I called housekeeping and let them know that I needed some soap and clean towels, and asked them to remove the dirty towel. They said they'd send someone up ... and when he arrived, he had the coffee that (he thought) I'd requested! (What? ... Coffee? ... How does "Soap" sound like "Coffee"??) (He did bring some, but not all the towels). Anyway, after asking him to remove the dirty towel (which evidently they hadn't told him about), he did go back and get the bar of soap I'd requested. After that, I went down to the (mostly empty) restaurant for a quick dinner. When I got to the restaurant reception desk, there was a very frustrated couple having a heated conversation with the gentleman behind the counter. When they stormed off, he showed me to my table and appologized that I had to hear the dissagreement with the previous patrons (although he placed all the blame on them). The waiter brought me a menu and some rolls. Then I waited, for about 15 mins, until another person was seated near me, and the waiter finally came back to take my order. When I asked what the "catch of the day" was, he said "tilapia". When I hesitated, he said the also have "fillet of sole" ... which I ordered. Imagine my surprise when he brought my dinner, and it was swordfish! Not a problem, really, but he didn't seem to notice until I called him on it! After dinner, I asked the waiter what time breakfast was served (since I had an 8:30 flight out). He said they open for breakfast at 6:00 am (which would just about give me enough time to have a quick breakfast and catch the shuttle to the airport (about a 1/2 mile) in the morning in time for my flight. Also, at a hotel at this level, you don't expect to see an old curved screen CRT television ... maybe it's a "retro" thing? Oh well, I only needed to stay for the one night, so the next morning I got up early enough to get ready and go down for breakfast (which was included as part of my room package). I arrived back at the restaurant at 6:00 am but was surprised to see it was dark. So, I went over to the hotel front desk and asked when and where they serve breakfast ... the woman there said that the restaurant should be opening about now and I had gone to the right place. So, figuring I might be a couple of minutes early, I went back to the restaurant and waited for about 5 minutes when a gentleman came out from the kitchen and (looking at me like I was in the wrong place) said the cook was "sick" that morning and to come back at 7:00 am (which was too late for me ... I told him that, but he didn't seem to care, and offered not alternatives). An airport hotel doesn't have more than one cook (it's a major international airport, so people are coming and going at all times ... and leaving early to catch a flight should be expected ... but they don't have a back-up plan!). I was more than happy to leave and have breakfast at the airport while waiting for my fligh! I don't recall any negative experience at a Starwoods hotel (some are better than others, but this one needs to lose its "flag" to get their act together!!). Unless there are no other options (there are dozens of hotels in close proximity), I'd avoidl this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Kitchener23
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Westin or Sheraton Gateway. Chose this hotel for the 24 hour check in check out that they offer. The email address for the 24 hour check in that they had on the web site was not working. I walked over from the Sheraton Gateway and spoke to a lady at the front desk and explained that I will be checking into the hotel 10 days later and would like to make use of it. She initially insisted that the email address worked and that I should use that. I explained several times that I had been trying for several days but it was not working. She took my reservation number and made a note in the system. When we checked in 10 days later at about 10.30pm I advised the front desk person that I will be checking out at 6.30pm. She said that I could not check out that late without paying a late check out fee. Had to explain that I actually fronted up to the hotel over a week earlier to advise the late check out time. She did not seem happy about that. Eventually we were given a key to a room. Went up to the room, we both were not happy about the room. Firstly we noticed a stale smell, also the carpet was dirty, also had two beds when we requested a king bed, Off to the front desk, same lady gave us another room key to check out. That room did not have any lights working. Back to reception again. In all we checked 4 other rooms. They too were not to our liking. The lady on the front desk at about 1030pm on Thursday 14 July (wish I had noted her name) had major attitude. She tried to say that they could not do anything for us as we had booked through a third party. I had booked directly with the hotel. Endured a night and at check out time, the front desk person tried to charge us an extra $60.00 for the late check out. I had to explain to him about the 24 hour stay. He went somewhere to check, came back and did not say anything. No apologies, nor did he ask how our stay was. I will NEVER stay again at this hotel. The photos that they show on their website of their rooms probably do not exist. We checked 6 rooms and did not see any room like those on the website. Avoid this hotel. The Westin and Sheraton Gateway are much better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: Corey1967
Reviews.Content: I have been going down to southern California to see my daughter for five years, and I had my worst hotel experience at the Four points Sheraton in LA. On this trip both my 17 year old daughter and my 8 year old daughter were with me. When we checked in, the women who helped me negatively noted that I had booked with a third party (Price line), and then proceeded to treat me like garbage. When I requested a double bed in our room, I was told none were available, and no alternative solution was offered. When I called to the front desk to request a fold down bed, the same women who checked me in answered the phone, and she told me that it might not fit, and that she would have to check with housekeeping. The woman at the front desk immediately called back and informed my daughter, who answered the phone, â€œ that there was no way the bed would fit into that room. â€œ Later, when I was down stairs I asked a man from housekeeping about the bed, he asked me my room number, but nothing happened. A few hours later, I called down to the front desk, and I let them know that I was not happy, and that I was going to call their corporate office and complain. The excuse I was given was that they didnâ€™t know I had checked in yet, even though I was talking to them from my room, which I had been given keys to at least 3 hours earlier when I checked in. Later someone called back and said a bed would fit in my room no problem, and one was finally brought up. The bed fit no problem with room to walk around it, and we could have fit another on in the room. The Ice machine on our floor, and the 2 below us were broken, and my Ice bucket leaked water all over the counter and floor of our bathroom (yes I used the plastic bag). The game controller that is supposed to be with the TV was missing, and the hotel had taken measures to insure you couldnâ€™t plug your own game into the TV, something we do at Marriot hotels all over southern cal all the time. During the whole time I stayed there, not one staff member asked me about my stay, including when I checked out, apparently they donâ€™t care.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Rates are Out of Control!”
Reviews.Author: Mconnors72
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and they treat me well but parking rates there are ridiculous - $19 a night as of July, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: mattbok
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to US and given the fact that all Starwood hotels in Downtown LA were fully booked. I've decided to choose Four Points by Sheraton over Sheraton Gateway and The Westin LAX. Although I could get a much lower corporate rate for Sheraton Gateway and The Westin LAX, yet I chose to stay at Four Points by Sheraton because I have never stayed in a Four Points by Sheraton hotel before and I wanted to experience it. It was a risk choosing the hotel since my stay duration was for 6 nights. My check-in was fast and done in less than 5 minutes, the front desk guy could consider putting on a smiling face though. After enduring a 31 hours flight, I didn't bother to take note of his name. I was given room no. 213, which is facing Airport Blvd. First impression upon entering the room is that it is the smallest room among all other Starwood hotels that I've stayed before. However, it's the least concern to me. Contrary to some comments on cleanliness of the room, mine was just fine although there were some stains on the wash basin but that was cleaned in the subsequent housekeeping routine. During my stay, one of the gym equipment was out of order, which was not fixed throughout my stay. I hope the equipment would be fixed soon. Throughout my stay, I have had the opportunity to seek help from staff at the guest service and each of them have been helpful. Since I rely on taxi to get around on some occasions, I have the staff at guest service to help me in arranging the transportation. I guess the only drawback in staying at LAX area is I have to pay a lot more to go to any place. Overall, I enjoyed my stay in Four Points by Sheraton. Many thanks to all guest service staff in Four Points by Sheraton LAX in making my stay an unforgettable. I look forward to visit LA again soon. Regards, matthew bok (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)

Reviews.Title: “Average stay here, there are better choices.”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the middle of the week for one night before flying out in the morning. The hotel is average at best, even for a Four Points. My room was supposedly remodelled but only the bathroom appeared new (and was quite nice) but the rest of the room did not seem new at all. Also, there should be an entrance from the back of the hotel so that if you park you don't have to walk around to the front.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: Dancearoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel. We were traveling in a group and our room was on the newly rennovated side of the hotel. Our friends were in the older part and they ended up moving with us as they didn't love their room as much. Our room however was spacious and very clean. The staff was polite and overall it was a nice hotel to stay in for one or two nights. Keep in mind breakfast and parking are additional charges here so I would recommed the Ihop down and around the corner in the mornings. Would visit again if needing a room nead the airport for late or early flights.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified motel with so so service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mmendez1
Reviews.Content: Didn't like dungeon door which led us to the enclosed old motel patio.

Reviews.Title: “No view, and the pool needed to be clean.”
Reviews.Author: Hassan72
Reviews.Content: Requested a king bed but was given two full size beds. Me and my wife had to sleep separate. Also our only window faced the hallway. I had to pay for parking. Not cool. Will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: Kruzein
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a great transit hotel. The room was clean, tidy, there were 2 beds in the room and they were very comfortable. The Bathroom was clean and fresh with toiletries provided. Downstairs was a very nice comfortable bar/restaurant area the range of beers on tap were very good and the food was very enjoyable. There was a free shuttle to and from the airport.. We had to checkout at 11am however our flight didnt leave until some 12 hours later and the staff at the hotel kept our luggage until later in the evening and we utilised the free shuttle back to the airport to get on the subway and go to Hollywood for the day then returned back to the airport onto the shuttle back to the hotel picked up the luggage and back to the airport in the shuttle. We would definentely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “subpar experience”
Reviews.Author: ssoh85
Reviews.Content: so I got there and was "checked in " by someone who did not know what he was doing. he asked for my address and other personal information and then took my credit card. we were then sent to the Incorrect room and was embarrassed to find someone was actually staying in the room he sent us to. we then had to go back to the desk where they took my credit card again and tried to 'correct' the check in and compensate the embarrassment by giving us a free breakfast... finally got to my room after having to pay for parking because they wouldn't help with that either and then was greeted by a shower that wouldn't drain...great.... oh and the toilet wouldn't flush right... what a joke steer clear from this place. they screwed up my check in and didn't do anything to help and just put us into some room with a broken bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, unorganized hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iamsoosh
Reviews.Content: On the first night my room was double booked and we had a hotel guest coming to our door trying to get in. On second night we came back to our room made up, very clean, but ac on full blast to an uncomfortable level. Finally parking was $19 a night which I think is highway robbery,.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: KateSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood preferred guest, I've stayed at this property multiple times, and every time I had a great experience! I came to expect indifference in big impersonal airport hotels, but this property really stands out because of caring and professional staff members. For example, not only an amazing conceirge Tereza Martinez arranged a car to take me and my Mom to the restaurant to celebrate her 78th birthday; she even found a vase for the bouquet I got for my Mom, and helped us with the bags turning down a tip. Now,this is really hard to come by in LA! The room service got us some dishes even though they were listed outside the regular breakfast/dinner hours. Cleaning ladies did an outstanding job on our room as well. Our room had super comfy beds and a great shower - two main things for me when I travel. The pool was big enough to do laps - another great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Easy airport access, good value, friendly employees!”
Reviews.Author: BoraBoraFonz
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying here, and we have enjoyed it every time. Four Points makes it very easy: you can be in your hotel room 20 minutes after you get your luggage! The pool area is nice, restaurants serve good food, and everything is good value. We walked one block to catch the trolley bus to Manhatten Beach, and enjoyed a wonderful afternoon out at the ocean. We felt safe at all times. We highly recommend Four Points LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good cleaning....”
Reviews.Author: nah3
Reviews.Content: Nice staff but, man, this hotel smelled horrible. The lobby was fine, but our floor and room smelled like they used to be smoking rooms or something. The night before we'd stayed at a Westin in Pasadena and really missed it. We won't be staying at this Sheraton again (only because of the smell)...

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend using the park and fly and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tlc2550
Reviews.Content: Good service, clean room, quiet. They state the shuttle bus runs every 15 minutes. We had to wait 30 minutes at 5 am. It did show up with a bus full of people. Best to expect a wait of 30 minutes in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “The whole family was delighted and highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: William_Nisperos-Tx
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant and warm welcome by front office personnel. I asked the receiving executive to check double queen bed instead of king bed, no problem I got it instantly. The room is spacious and clean and at the price I paid this is good deal! ! I attended my daughters graduation at Staples Center and drop her at LAX the following day. It's so convenient and a lot of fast food within the hotel vicinity. Kudos to the housekeeping staff, my daughter was frantic upon discovering she lost her Nokia cellphone. To our surprise housekeeping personnel kept it and give to us when we return. It's hard to find a genuine service this days. Love this hotel ! !

Reviews.Title: “This was an extremely satisfying and very positive-minded experience”
Reviews.Author: Leon1958
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel staff appeared to me to have always had a "ready to serve their customers" attitude or approach on the very top of their minds and efforts = 100% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: Jodan29
Reviews.Content: The thing that stood out above all else was the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. Anytime something was wrong or I needed help, they all jumped to the task. The bed was comfortable, too. The shuttle service to and from the hotel was great. I didn't have to worry about a cab. My only comment would be to the hotel and all hotels, they need to provide a mirror so we ladies can see the back of our hair when trying to fix it! Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price- would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sletizia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location-close to the airport with frequent transportation to/from- rooms very clean and modern- staff was very friendly and knowledgeable- had good amenities- and most importantly was reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful, great rooms will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: sunkissed-skeeder
Reviews.Content: I live in the Central Coast of Calif. I needed to take my daughter to LAX. She was going to China and her plane left at 1:30 AM. I also had 2 of her friends who had just finished a 2 week visit. They were leaving at 6:30 AM. To top it off I had another daughter returning from Mexico the next day. My hotel experience was crucial to my surviving this hectic trip. Four Points Sheraton LAX was wonderful. Their accommodations were relaxing, the beds comfortable and room service tasty. Try the Chipolte Hamburger! They graciously accommodated my extra requests. I am definitely returning to the Four Points Sheraton LAX!!!.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when flying out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: Sheilab144
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Preferred guests and always get generous rooms on the 6th floor even tho' we pay with Amex points. We are treated as special guests and sometimes you even give us cookies - but not this last time. In fact, we missed them. Internet connection usually fails to work, however, so it is impossile to do any work or use my computer. YOu might want to find a new ISP

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Wandering-Trekker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on May 1 and May 2 while I was receiving treatment at UCLA Medical Center. We ate there both days and were very pleased with not only the food, but the staff as well. The staff was very polite and attentive to anything we needed. I spoke with the manager, Jose Ortega, to inform him how much we enjoyed our dining experience. I wish I could remember the name of the busboy who was especially helpful. Although he was not a waiter, he should be!!!! Thank you again for making a difficult time better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a traveler. Just 4 a day”
Reviews.Author: Kantabria13
Reviews.Content: It,s the perfect hotel for a traveler. If you need to rest or have a perfect situation before a long trip, this is the perfect hotel. Good bed, 120 dollar final price, and very close to the airport. Every 15 minutes bus to the airport. A bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Hygiene”
Reviews.Author: garychan172
Reviews.Content: Bed sheets did not seem clean, had stain on it. Shower towels were awful. Green mold? Needs to improve on overall cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChiefDennis
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to return to this hotel. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Rooms have recently been refurbished and the new carpet, paint, furniture, and TWO flat screen TVs (in the suites) are wonderful. Breakfast buffet could use some attention to detail and a better menu but service and comfort are nice. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “The complete staff is awsome, Me and my husband "Love the 4 Points"”
Reviews.Author: Ilegbameh
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stay at the 4 points at least once a month, we refuse to stay any where else. Fat check in/out, food is good, and service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Trish was the best!”
Reviews.Author: anniegrove
Reviews.Content: Trish went above and beyond when it came to customer service. We had a small problem, and she made sure that the issue was addressed, and then went the extra mile to make sure we were happy. Trish is the type of employee that all hotels would want on their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with GREAT Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MeetingPlanner007
Reviews.Content: I booked a two day conference for the Western Division Meeting of Duvel USA. Everything about the experience was first class! The rooms were great, the staff were professional and the conference arrangements were exactly what I was looking for. Phil Baxter (Hotel Manager) and his team provided me with everything I needed to run my event seemlessly. I would have no hestiation recommending this hotel as a great place to hold any kind of business function.

Reviews.Title: “Parking...to charge, or not to charge, that is the question”
Reviews.Author: LVfrosty
Reviews.Content: First off, the property is good overall value and very close to LAX. The rooms were pretty nice, restaurant had an INSANE beer selection which I was very pleased with. I stayed 2 nights back-to-back as I had to extend a business trip. The first night I wasn't charged for parking. The second night I was. I spoke to 3 different people about the charge and basically was told "tough $hit". If you're going to charge me $19 per night (20% of the cost of the room) for parking, at least be consistent with your gouging. A corporate rate should not include a parking charge, period.

Reviews.Title: “Great Extended Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: OldGrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for an extended stay during May & June. I had a room facing Airport Blvd which was very clean, spacious and gave me a view of the sunset. I used all the facilities except for the heath center & airport shuttle. During my stay the hotel was full on several occasions but the staff remained cheerful & helpful throughout my stay. I'm coming back to LA later this year and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: von_levi
Reviews.Content: I landed in LA at 10 AM, had meetings in the area until 8 PM, and flew out the next morning at 6AM, so I needed a place near the airport, and given how little time I was going to be in the hotel, there was really no point in spending a lot of money. My expectations were pretty low for a Four Points near the airport, but I was impressed with the cleanliness. For my very short stay I have no real complaints, except that the walls facing the hallway could have been a bit thicker. I'll probably stay here again for similar less than 24 hour trip.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: dannysau
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was really great i rally liked the service and the people that work there were really polite like trish and juan. in my stays they offered me a great costumer service. i also like the room details and the bottle of water its a great product inside beacuse whan i come i dont have to go buy a bottlle of water right away. thank u for the great service and i look foward staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Twice Bitten Now”
Reviews.Author: KateVB
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Preferred Guests, having joined when we stayed at the hotel in May. Unfortunately that was not a great experience as there was a noise in the ceiling all night which made sleep difficult. We mentioned this on checkout and were told we would be put in an upgraded room on our return in June - which we were - I guess!! A bigger and more attractive room. However, it was next door to a locked room (not guestroom) and also backed onto the room where ice and cold drinks were available. Hence.......very little sleep again. The noise made it impossible to get a proper night's sleep. Yes, we should have complained but had come in from a London flight, quickly unpacked (initially thinking the noise was air conditioning, so turned that down), went for dinner and by the time we got back to our room and realised the noise was coming from next door the thought of packing and moving rooms was all too much. Bad decision. As I said in the heading - twice bitten! Should we go back - the jury is out on that one. On the positive side, this is a well priced, well situated hotel, was clean with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “we had a wonderful time and we will definitly be back”
Reviews.Author: BRASZELS
Reviews.Content: My daughters school was having a sleep over so my husband and I decided to stay near the school just incase of an emergency so we stayed at this hotel. We had the Jr. Suite, the room was beautifully furnished with 2 flat screens, and refrigertaor and a very comfortable bed. We had such a good time. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I did not get the chance to dine at the resturants but my husband had a few drinks at the bar and he was very happy with the service and his drinks. although we live locally we will definitly stay here again because we really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Eww...”
Reviews.Author: Eklondon
Reviews.Content: Judging from the reviews and the Sheraton name, I purposely picked this hotel but was sorely disappointed. The room that I got smelled like an ashtray upon entering (even though the entire hotel is non-smoking.) I asked to be moved because it bothered me, and the room that they tried to move me to looked like it was in a Motel 6, with a window out into the hallway, so I went back to the original room. It didn't help that the staff member who was to show me to my room didn't bother to help me with my luggage, and I was struggling to keep up with him as I carried my suitcase and two heavy bags. The bed was lumpy, the chair had spots all over it that gave me great doubt about the cleanliness of the rest of the room. The bathroom also was of a motel quality and the air conditioner was so loud all night, but there was no other way to deal with the smoky stench. It is doubtful I'd ever venture a Four Points again and I really regret not picking the Crowne Plaza or Hilton because they were priced the same and believe me this is not the same category!

Reviews.Title: “Cash Payment”
Reviews.Author: UTinMaungWin
Reviews.Content: As I am from Myanmar (Burma) and we do not have internationally accepted credit card system. It would be great, if you could let us book and pay by cash. It is inconvenient to ask US residence friends to assist. But I need more stay to make my comment on your property more accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, hotel staff was very helpful”
Reviews.Author: MamaMel73
Reviews.Content: I booked a two queen room online for our stay at the Four Points by Sheraton at LAX. When we arrived we were the only ones checking in at the time so check in was very smooth. They had a staff member help us to our room (we had a ton of luggage). Our original room wasin a strange older part of the hotel and it was fairly run down. Also, it had two double beds NOT two queens. The hotel employee told us he'd wait while I called the front desk and explain the mix up. I did and they asked me to hold for a moment. The gentleman came back on the line and said they could give us a new room. Our new room was much larger and had the two queen beds as we requested. The room was very nice and clean and in the newer portion. As the evening went on we were checking the place out and noticed that several people were attempting to check in and it was taking forever. They had a long line of guests waiting and only 2 staff members checking people in- although the counter looked like it could hold about 6 staff members. The pool itself looked dirty and the snack bar/burger stand at the pool was closed. This was a bummer. The only nice thing was the lounge chairs and tables. Also only 2 of 3 elevators were running and it was a rough ride in those. All and all it was an ok place to stay or the $120.00 we paid for one night. Very conveniant to LAX location. Longer than a one night stay, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel horrid bar service”
Reviews.Author: DRL1956
Reviews.Content: We found this Sheraton to have nice, comfortable rooms with a pleasant bar and pool area.
